The plant produces tiny, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and stamens. It thrives in arid or rocky environments, often found in dry, sandy soils across regions of Europe and North Africa. Thecophyllum vittatum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
